conclusion: Analyze the internal resistance of the silicon photocell when it forms a closed loop with the resistance R.
Line a represents the voltage-current (U-I) relationship of the silicon photocell battery.
Line b represents the U-I relationship of resistance R.
The intersection point represents the operating point when they form a closed loop.
The intersection of lines a and b occurs at Current (I) = 0.2 A and Voltage (U) = 2.5 V.
This is the operating point of the circuit when the photocell and resistor R are connected.
Using Ohm's Law: R = U/I, R = 2.5 V / 0.2 A = 12.5 Ω.
The internal resistance is not constant, need to find it at the specific operating point.
When a battery with EMF (E) and internal resistance (r) is connected to an external resistance (R), the current is: I = E/(R + r).
The terminal voltage is: U = E - Ir.
When I = 0, U ≈ 3.6 V, which is the open-circuit voltage (EMF) of the photocell.
At the operating point (0.2 A, 2.5 V): 2.5 = 3.6 - 0.2r.
The internal resistance of the silicon photocell at this light intensity when forming a closed loop is 5.5 Ω.
